title: As COVID Cases And Death Toll Surge, Sri Lanka Extends Lockdown Till September 6
snippet: Amid the rise in COVID-19 cases, the Sri Lankan government has decided to extend the lockdownt till September 6.The lockdown was due to end on August 30.

title: 4,591 COVID-19 positive cases reported in Sri Lanka today
snippet: A total of 4,591 COVID-19 positive cases were reported in Sri Lanka, stated the Epidemiology Unit. The total count of positive coronavirus cases found in Sri Lanka currently sits at 416,961.

title: The Latest: Arizona has had more than 1M coronavirus cases
snippet: Arizona has now had more than 1 million confirmed coronavirus infection cases. State health officials on Friday reported 3,707 additional COVID-19 cases, putting the state beyond the grim milestone. Arizona is the 13th U.

title: Lending a helping hand...
snippet: Police officers from the Dam Street police station distributed lunch packets to paupers who are living on the sidewalks in Pettah. It was a great solace for them at the time the whole country is under quarantine curfew.

title: The Latest: Judge says Florida schools can mandate masks
snippet: School districts in Florida may impose mask mandates, a judge said Friday, ruling that Gov. Ron DeSantis overstepped his authority by issuing an executive order banning the mandates.

title: The Latest: Sudan receives 200,000 vaccine doses from France
snippet: Sudan received on Friday a shipment of 218,400 doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine as a donation from France, according to UNICEF. The vaccines were delivered to the east African nation with UNICEF's support and through COVAX,

title: Sri Lanka, Russia to enhance bilateral security cooperation
snippet: Secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation Nikolai Patrushev has met with Secretary of the Ministry of Defence of Sri Lanka Kamal Gunaratne in Moscow, the Security Council said on Thursday.

title: SLT-Mobitel donates HDU beds to Kegalle General Hospital
snippet: In its continued efforts to help Sri Lanka fight against the Covid-19 pandemic, SLT-Mobitel has donated high-dependency unit (HDU) beds to the Kegalle General Hospital, to support the critical care and treatment of COVID-19 patients.

title: Nippon Paint 3-in-1 MediFresh covers several healthcare facilities
snippet: Nippon Paint recently initiated a campaign to galvanize healthcare facilities around Sri Lanka with their latest product 3-in-1 MediFresh which is an antibacterial coating developed with Silver & Zinc ions to keep disease-causing microorganisms at bay.
